website_summaries.verdict: One of the newest smart TCL TVs in a compact size that comes with features the brand is known for, including crisp video and Roku.
pros: Updated for 2019 with an uncomplicated interface that's easy to navigate
Features the brand's built-in Roku for effortless streaming of numerous popular apps
cons: The downside of the newness of this model is that if there are any software bugs, you may be one of the first customers to find them

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Roku software is slow and kinda dumbed down. There are no multi-search options. Everything about Roku is slow. Slow loading up different channels. Slow at loading youtube and registering button clicks. If you don't need to use any apps etc. Picture and TV is cheap to use. If you rely on apps and other crap, don't get this.
customer_reviews.author: John smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have a decent TV at a great price with Roku built in
customer_reviews.text: I never realized how convenient it would be to have Roku built in so that a single remote controls all TV functions (on/off, volume, input select) and all Roku functions. And the picture quality is fine and the price was really excellent. Also, it's very small and light - something that was an advantage for me. Only possible complaint: there are absolutely no controls on the TV itself. You can't do anything without the remote. You might want to have a spare around just in case.
customer_reviews.author: xgrep

customer_reviews.title: Nice Monitor with a Vibrant Screen
customer_reviews.text: Great for use as a monitor for presentations; light weight, slim profile and VESA mount points on the back. This unit also supports screen mirroring; which I needed. The buttons on the curved side of the remote are a little annoying and there are no physical controls on the unit itself. Make sure you turn off the power saver feature and disable the screen saver or the set might turn off or go to the screen saver if it doesn't detect a video signal.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Bates

customer_reviews.title: Good TV, Beware bedroom use
customer_reviews.text: No, this isn't going to be some funny review about not being able to sleep because you've got your TV on in the bedroom. ;) I wish it were. But I can't sleep with the TV on, otherwise the bright white light at the bottom of the TV (when it's turned off) wouldn't bother me. This light also doubles as a sensor so you can't block it. I have temporarily placed my girl scout cookie box in the way of the brightness.. which makes me hungry for cookies, pretty sure that's a win for me. I'm going to go make some ice cream coffee now. :) Cheers
customer_reviews.author: Thatsthegoodstuff

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I love these TV’s. This is the 3rd one I’ve put in my house. Super cheap affordable tv that comes with a Roku built in. Its’s perfect. All my kids seem to watch is YouTube or streaming services. We cut the cord to cable about 2 years ago now and don’t miss it so this having Roku abilities built in is perfect! You seriously can’t be what you get for the price! Great size and picture. I do wish the volume was better but I can’t complain for the value. If you pair it with a sound bar you’ll be totally set!
customer_reviews.author: Chester629

customer_reviews.title: If you use ROKU, you should get a ROKU tv!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is an ingenious product. I have a Roku external device for all of my home TVs. This has it all built in and couldn't be easier. It was a snap to set up and has become our main TV. The picture is pretty good, not remarkable and picture adjustment is not optimal. You can only adjust it so much. I would prefer the picture be a little darker, but you are limited by the controls. Still, overall I am very happy with this set. It is super light weight and the picture is large. It completely fills the frame, and fits nicely in our cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Tubadoc

customer_reviews.title: Love TCL! Best IST Ever!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I brought a TCL tv first. Now my whole family has them. They are awesome tv’s! Will be getting a bigger one for me room soon hopefully. But they are the best TVs out. All those big names have no comparisons TCL should be a household name I promise you. Once you get to know it you will love it. It’s like apple when it was Macintosh. But budget friendly! Believe me! I’ve had fire sticks which I love, Roku stand alones and Apple TV’s. TCL comes first, fire stick and then apple depending on your overall goals. But hands down just tv smart tv aspect TCL roku has it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Not the night resolution, but easy setup and good picture,  Very poor remote.
customer_reviews.text: You can’t get a smartLED TV better than this for the same cost. Setup went easy and I recommend for a bedroom. Update: Taken off one star. The remote that comes with tv is horrible. You have to keep pressing the same button multiple times for the tv to respond. Also does not have numbers to go directly to a particular channel. You have to keep pressing channel up or down until you get to your channel and with the poor remote response makes it a very unpleasent experience and I can’t recommend this TV.
customer_reviews.author: DSP

customer_reviews.title: Speakers don’t work
customer_reviews.text: Barely 11 month into purchase and speakers don’t work anymore. Is a kitchen TV mounted on wall away from any other devices and no reason for speakers to not work. Very dissatisfied with tv. You get what you pay for. Have a branded tv over 10 years old and sees much much more use by kids and still works perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: A BIG Disappointment!!!
customer_reviews.text: So excited to get this ROKU TV. Within the first week, a problem emerged and I thought it was a fluke. TV would not turn off no matter what I tried, finally had to unplug. Plugging back in did not fix problem, unless I kept it unplugged for at least 4 hours. This happened again in the second week. Again, I hoped this was something that was not a permanent issue. When it happened again in week 3, I called to return it. I was convinced to accept a partial refund and instructed on how to reset the TV if this continued. Now I'm not sure if the "Turkey" is the TV or me. . Keep shopping for another brand!
customer_reviews.author: Giovanna

customer_reviews.title: Great Little TV
customer_reviews.text: Great little TV. We just got AT&T TV and the picture is clear, the streaming is fast and it’s very easy to use. Also light as air.
customer_reviews.author: ckmia

customer_reviews.title: Picture is good, sound isnt
customer_reviews.text: Picture is good, but the sound is inconsistent and drifts. So about every 30 minutes the sound will be around a second or two off and I need to change the channel and change it back to get the sound to align with the video again. Its a bit....annoying.
customer_reviews.author: M. Berreth

customer_reviews.title: Great tv, troublesome remote
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tv except after a month the remote keeps losing signal and doesn't work. I had to download the roku remote app onto my phone...use it...then it reengages. It does it several times a night. Very irritating.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Raiser

customer_reviews.title: Overall, Good TV for the price.
customer_reviews.text: As looking to buy a screen that I could use to extend my laptop while attending online classes and labs and figured out I might as well get myself a TV. This TV is very good for the price. It can connect to internet even though I am on the third floor and the wifi router is on the first floor. The Roku Channel.comes with some free TV options too. And I can easily connect it to my laptop via wireless connection. It does lag when the connection is down but that is more because I am located far from the router.
customer_reviews.author: Koami S.

customer_reviews.title: uSE A usb bLUETOOTH dONGLE FOR SETTING UP bLUETOOTH hEADPHONES OR sPEAKER
customer_reviews.text: TV works great! I had to move my wifi extender closer to the camper for it to pickup signal. I was concerned about the use of Bluetooth Headphones for private listening, and I didn't want to run the battery down on my phone, so I used a simple Bluetooth Dongle. It works great! I also use it for a portable Braven speaker to get better sound while watching sports, etc. Currently, streaming the xfinity app, and watching live tv where ever I have a wifi signal. Great deal for $130!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice design and functionality at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second TCL TV. (replacing the one I broke; screen.. oops!) I am very impressed with TCL, however, I'm not sure if this is an issue with my cable signal or the television. When I change channels there is a millisecond, static "chirp" when the next channel pops up. If anyone else has this issue I would like to hear about it. (Any possible workarounds, or is it defective?) Other than that, it is a wonderful TV and the remote and menus are very user friendly and any new purchaser will quickly wrap their head around the "flow" without having to look at the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Rory Mclyndon

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great TV. I had it out of the box and set up and playing with a new Roku account in under half an hour. Plugged in a DVD player and an Apple TV and they are running great too. Picture and sound are great. I'm very happy with the purchase. (I will be even more happy when there's an Apple app I can use with Roku I hear that is coming soon.)
customer_reviews.author: m. adams

customer_reviews.title: NOT A TV. More like a Roku with a screen.
customer_reviews.text: If you happen to be someone who doesn't have a TV, and for some reason is looking for a Roku anyway despite having nothing to connect it to, you hit the jackpot. Unless you plan to actually watch TV. The actual problem really is the remote. With no number buttons, you have to actually click through every single channel on live TV to get to the one you want. If you are watching channel 5 and want to go to channel 32 - you have to click through every single channel to get there. Absolutely irritating and useless as a television.
customer_reviews.author: Gunslinger

customer_reviews.title: Sound not coming in clear
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this TV not even a year ago, and the volume scrambles, sounds fuzzy, and doesn’t work right. Sometimes issue can be resolved after turning tv on and off several times. TV should work a lot longer than a year for what I paid. Would not buy again and don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DUAL PURPOSE COMPUTER MONITOR
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Roku TV to be used both as a computer monitor for my iMac Mini and as an additional TV. Works great! I used it to stream tv near my newly installed hot tub. It was nice nice not to have to worry about running cable lines here and there. I was even able to charge my cellphone through the USB-3 port on the back. As a flat screen, it doesn't take up much space and by it being so light weight, it is easily transported. I may get a larger one to keep permanently on the back patio. GREAT PRODUCT! It is way more versatile than the overrated Samsungs!
customer_reviews.author: Darin W.

customer_reviews.title: Ok for a cheap tv
customer_reviews.text: This tv is ok, but not great. The picture is as expected. The smart features are a little annoying to use after using higher end tvs. They just aren't quite as user friendly to navigate. The fact that you have to make a Roku account just to use the smart features is annoying as well, since I bought this because it was a cheap smart TV for my kids room, not because it has Roku. The input options are disappointing, as there is no USB option and no casting option. I won't buy a TV from this brand again, but I will use this one until my kid is ready for an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Great bedroom or kids room TV
customer_reviews.text: Great bedroom or kids room tv. It was easy to move our existing Roku account over. I like that our paid cable feed can be on the home page of the tv. Make sure you adjust the colors on the TV. We were a little disappointed at first and then we remembered to adjust the colors. It’s a good picture now. Not 1080p but it’s good. Oh and it’s very thin and light
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie G

customer_reviews.title: BUY RIGHT NOW
customer_reviews.text: I was a little iffy at first on buying a TV online but after reading a lot of reviews and now that I have it I can say that you Can’t beat this TV for the pricing. You can hook up an Xbox PlayStation or Nintendo switch to it ,great remote ,picture and sound quality is amazing, and the TV is overall super super amazing the only problem is is that my LED lights are interconnected with the wavelengths from the remote so when I change the buttons on the remote my LED lights change but that’s no problem besides that the TV is the best one I’ve ever seen and you Cannot beat it for the pricing
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tv but remote has no numbers to input channel.
customer_reviews.text: TV is great and the volume is good. Reason i gave it a low rating was because the included remote does not have numbers. You need to scroll up or down the channels to go to another channel. Since there are no numbers you just can't press what number channel you want. This TV was for an extra room with no cable, so this became a problem quickly. I called Amazon and TCL and they couldn't tell me what remote would work.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moreno

customer_reviews.title: You won't get the world, but you shouldn't expect the world
customer_reviews.text: Look, this is a cheap 720p smart TV. The picture isn't stunning. The performance of the Roku smart features is kinda meh-- the menu stutters sometimes and apps don't always work perfectly smoothly. But for as cheap as it is, you can't really complain. It does what it says on the box. I just wish the remote had a headphone jack and had dedicated number buttons. That's about it for actual gripes.
customer_reviews.author: P. DeCastro

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with Cracked screen can't return after 30 days
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with cracked screen. Amazon will not replace after 30 days. My bad for not knowing the 30 day return period but I looked for that statement after the fact and still could not find it (I am sure it is there somewhere). Purchased to replace a TV my son took with him to college and did not get a chance to set it up until today (3 weeks past return period). The person I spoke with at Amazon was nice but could not do anything to help (not her fault of course). I have always bought Sony, Visio, etc.. and this was the first time I purchased a TCL. Lesson Learned.
customer_reviews.author: CajunBlade

customer_reviews.title: Bad audio, no BlueTooth
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Great Picture. RokuTV Channel has tons of free content, including free movies. Lots of different streaming apps to choose from built right in. Dislikes. Audio is a deal breaker. Sounds like 3in mono speaker in a coffee can. You can only pair with RokuTV Wireless Speakers; no Bluetooth option. There is a headphone jack and optical audio port, but that means a wired connection. If audio quality is important to you, skip this tv, and pay a bit more for a tv with BlueTooth. That way, if you don't like the audio quality, you can at least connect a sound bar wirelessly. Another big dislike is that providing a credit card number during initial setup is required.
customer_reviews.author: Kaiser Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects from wifi every night.
customer_reviews.text: My wifi password (set by ISP) is long and annoying, especially when I have to scroll around the screen for five minutes with the dinky remote to "type" it all in. No reason for TV to disconnect every night - it sits on top of the same TV stand as the router, and they're within one foot of each other with no obstructions of any kind. Google this issue, and you'll find people complaining about this problem since 2018. But hey -- the screen is nice, when it can actually show you something.
customer_reviews.author: DBinSD

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TV for such a GREAT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: Arrived yesterday. Took longer to screw in legs than to set up TV on screen. Very easy to do. The only time-consuming part for me was phone call with cable company to have signal sent to new TV and to re-program my cable remote so it was in sync. Excellent picture and color and sound! Easy to get to Netflix and Prime. I've only had it 24 hours, but very satisfied so far. Can't believe it was only $130. Quality far exceeds my former Samsung TV that I paid over $500 for seven years ago.
customer_reviews.author: C Richards

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality. Won’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Very low quality. From the first day I started using the tv. It has black squares that pop in the screen during a movie. As if some of the cells were burned out. Disappointing since I paid someone to install it and then I find out it doesn’t work properly. I’ve only had the tv two days and it’s getting worse. I don’t imagine the tv will make it past a year. Not worth the money. Better off paying a few bucks extra for a Vizio
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto G. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Best Smart TV on the market!!!
customer_reviews.text: I usually do not write reviews, but this might help some one. The TV is great we have 4 Roku TV’s. Be very careful when u register the tv, a code will come up with a link to put on a computer or your phone browser. Roku is Free if u go to Wong sight it will tell u to call a number and when u call the want to charge u, it’s a scam. Roku is always Free, they have pay channels on there website u can purchase but be very careful when registering the TV. Love the Roku tv, very easy to use. Never ever had a problem with the tv.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck and Amy

customer_reviews.title: Adaptive, fine picture quality and inexpensive!
customer_reviews.text: This TCL 32” television is light weight, propped on slender plastic foot stands with the audio coming two (2) small speakers beneath and on the bottom of the screen. Setup can be modestly complicated. The picture however is cracking sharp. It comes with one small remote which takes some learning to get used to but the control panel ( on the back) allows one to hook up and watch Blu rays off a separate Blu ray player linked to superior audio speakers via Aux audio connections. The price was right on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: JEDrury

customer_reviews.title: Great TV for the Kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12 year old's room, so we weren't fighting over the main TV at night. The picture quality is great. The integrated Roku works great. We've been using Roku for years so this was a perfect choice. The remote is a Roku remote, so we're accustomed to that already. The sound isn't great, but it's a flat screen. I'm already planning to buy a soundbar for it. I hadn't heard of TCL before, but when I checked reviews on other websites, they were very positive. The price is hard to beat. Hopefully this TV lasts as long as the more well known brands.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan S

customer_reviews.title: Good TV, terrible monitor.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good cheap TV with a lot of good features. Easy setup, and quick internet connection. All the streaming features are nice. However, if you had planned on using this for a computer monitor, go elsewhere. Just too fuzzy for close work.
customer_reviews.author: Awayteam

customer_reviews.title: Great Extra TV
customer_reviews.text: I have too many people who want to watch something different. Instead of paying for extra cable boxes, I got this and added the apps I wanted to watch. Also added the DVR feature and it works great... Dual-band feature, great picture quality. Beats going to a box store and getting on there to find out... OOPS! They have all 6 tied together and to the wall... I am not one to wait for someone who "has the key" to get what I want. Big enough for where I have it and can still relax without being bothered.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: What internet connection?
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying this for what I bought it for, which was Roku, then DON'T. This tv for some odd reason will not connect to any wifi. I am very electronic impaired and I have tried everything! It connected for about an hour when I first plugged it in and after that nothing. I ended up connecting a separate Roku device. I could have bought a better tv with the $40 spent on that. However the tv as a stand a lone is not bad at all. The picture is clear which is the reason for the 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Great TV but horrible for wall mount
customer_reviews.text: I have another TCL TV, bigger and both work awesome. With this TV however trying to get any type of wall mounting kit is impossible. The spaces between the screw holes is only 3.5 inches! And trying to put any wall mount kit on it is nearly impossible. Screws that are supplied with any generic kits are too long. I had to go out and find shorter screws but the heads are too small to secure the wall mount kits. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: A Catlover In Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Television great, remote not.
customer_reviews.text: The television itself is a 5 star, the remote is not. The back to keep the battery's in came faulty, it will not stay on and slips right now, if the remote falls or slips off the table the batteries go flying out. I did not buy a band new television to also have to go buy a universal remote.
customer_reviews.author: Alysssa Ledgerwood

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a gash in the box that was resealed. Cord had been poorly wrapped. Used? Returned item? Time will tell. Remote is horrible. Can't help to turn vol up .... Or down....or mute every time you pick it up. Who designed this? Must have been a left handed person! Lost half my saved channels for no reason. Did a channel scan again to restore. All this said, it has a reasonable picture and doesn't lose the wifi signal like my old set. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: PNW Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Not this model!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our son for his birthday. He spent 3 hours on the phone with tech, who told him the software was out of date and needed to be updated. It won’t connect to WiFi. We bought a flash drive and it still won’t update. I’ve tried To use the “exchange”’feature here on amazon and it won’t work, either. So disappointed in this product and purchase and lack of support to correct the issue. Not to mention- the tv am remote and scratched and Seem to be remanufactured?
customer_reviews.author: Leslie S

customer_reviews.title: This TV is worthless!
customer_reviews.text: This TV is terrible. Setup went fine out of the package. Worked for about two hours. Now it won’t connect to wi-fi and just constantly errors out. We’ve tried rebooting, restoring settings, moving closer to the router...everything the help desk suggests...nothing helps. It shows our network, but won’t connect. After googling it seems like this is a common problem, but no good fix. It also doesn’t recognize anything plugged in to the HDMI inputs (DVD or console). At this rate we’ll be returning this and getting a better quality TV.
customer_reviews.author: T.L.S.

customer_reviews.title: New TV, Old Timey Issues
customer_reviews.text: This is what I am experiencing each time I turn this unit on for the day. This is an office television and has had little use in the few days since it has arrived. I keep having to unplug and plug back in to get the home screen. I didn’t expect this to be 4K or anything but I have older TVs that have never done this, it is especially disheartening to experience this less than a week into ownership. Typically, it costs more to send amazon items back than what it’s worth, so I will see what their customer service says but for now, I wasn’t expecting this—hence the low stars.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Lewis

customer_reviews.title: SO LAGGY!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This TV would be fine if it worked. It is so incredibly laggy, the loading screen takes at least 10 minutes. I am returning this and ordered the amazon fire tv and hopefully that is more responsive. Tonight it has taken over 30 minutes loading, I just gave up.
customer_reviews.author: abi

customer_reviews.title: Audio doesn't work, Color is weird
customer_reviews.text: Two audio problems, both often reported on message boards. 1. Audio doesn't play. Each time you turn it on you have to reset an audio control (Volume setting in Audio Options) 2. Audio is a frame out of sync. It is especially apparent if you have a sound bar attached and have both the TV speakers and sound bar playing. Getting life-like colors is difficult. People are either orange or blue. Compared to a similarly priced 32" Samsung it is much inferior.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond happy with this TV! It was packed well and arrived in perfect condition. It was quick and easy to set up using the booklet that came with it. I think many of the negative comments I read were the result of someone not checking the booklet. Every question I had was discussed in the booklet and a couple of times when I needed to troubleshoot or adjust something, it was also addressed in the booklet! The remote is very small but has a good design and is easy to use. Sound quality is very good for any streaming TV programs but it is not as good with Pandora music.
customer_reviews.author: C. W.

customer_reviews.title: great quality for $$
customer_reviews.text: This is not a 4k tv, but at 32", it's not really needed. This makes a great addition for a bedroom, craftroom, or even outside (providing it's out of the weather). I put one in our guest room, one in my wifes craft room, and one outside in our covered tiki bar/outdoor kitchen. The picture is very sharp, the sound is not home theater in any stretch, but is still quite adequate , and the smart user interface is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Garth

customer_reviews.title: A Real Breeze to Set Up and Use!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Delivered at 2:30, set up with Direct TV and ALL my streaming channels by 3:30! They’ve made the set up a breeze! After reading all the different complaints here, I was very pleased to find that none of them were an issue! Best low cost tv purchase I’ve ever made and I’m 66!
customer_reviews.author: Demitria L. McDuff

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what it cracked up to be
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Just 10 days after purchasing this TV and the sound has almost completely gone out. Every 15-20 minutes, it has to be turned off and turned back on to get the sound to work. Returning ASAP. Hi Remote lags; does NOT connect to Alexa without a minimum of three downloaded apps and even then, shoddy connection at best to a couple of apps; Remote app on phone connection is spotty. Definitely got what I paid for, but a little upset that the specific thing that I purchased it for doesn’t even work.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Wilde

customer_reviews.title: TV is fine except for the included remote, which is hit-or-miss.
customer_reviews.text: The picture and interface are fine, but the remote requires multiple presses to get the TV to react. I bought an accessory remote in hopes that that would solve the problem, but it was just as iffy as the remote that comes with the set. You might as well resign yourself to using the remote app on your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great TV for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended a TCL TV from a friend and am very glad I took their advice. Set up was quick & easy and there are so many free channels to choose from with Roku. I do not have cable so I'm thrilled that Pluto TV, Netflix, Hulu, etc. were already loaded into the TV. Enter my password and voila! Easy peasy. The picture is very good. And for those of us who fall asleep with the TV on, there is a sleep timer which is not always available on every TV. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Hart

customer_reviews.title: Awesome until it disconnects from the Wifi
customer_reviews.text: I really love the Roku TV! There are so many free channels and shows on there. It's unbelievable how much is offered for free! I only have one beef with it and that is that every time I turn it on, I have to reconnect it to the wifi. It is very close to the router, so I don't understand this at all. This is a minor annoyance though considering all that I have received from the TV. The picture and the sound both work great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaddict

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic purchase
customer_reviews.text: This TV is clear and is the perfect size for a master bedroom TV. Picture clarity is fantastic, east to set up - the only thing I might have reconfigured was the remote control. The volume control is on the right side and is easy to bump. But that is just a small issue - overall for the price and all of the upgrades that come with a smart TV - I am more than satisfied with this one!
customer_reviews.author: BuyingonLine

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: The TV is exactly as described and beyond easy to get set up. It turns on very quick and streams effortlessly. An added plus is that you can link it up to your phone so you can type in the search bar more easily than using the remote control. I went for the lower picture quality and it is perfectly nice! I'm glad I didn't spend the money for the more expensive version.
customer_reviews.author: FAN

customer_reviews.title: Decent inexpensive TV - Have to know how to change out of Low Power Mode
customer_reviews.text: This TV isn't bad for $120. However, the default "Low Power" picture mode is horrible! I could not figure out how to change the picture mode (you'd think in settings, but not with this TV). You have to press the asterisk button on the remote while watching a program and that will bring up a menu of more advanced picture settings where you can customize your picture. How did I learn this? From the automated hold message while on with TLC customer support! The rep didn't know how to do this, but the hold message did!
customer_reviews.author: C. Weesner

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use on my outside patio and also in my bedroom. it's very light weight. I haven't figured out how to use it outside because it's often breezy at my house. I didn't want to have to mount it on the wall. This is my 3rd Roku TV. Makes life very convenient. But the remotes for all 3 TVs are very poor quality. Hopefully they won't get dropped on the floor too many times.
customer_reviews.author: Marylou Hansen

customer_reviews.title: TCL Great TV
customer_reviews.text: I bought the TCL 323 inch as I have a 65inch in the living room and wanted one for the bedroom,. The one fault is that you have to use two controllers if you have Direct TV - one to turn on the DirecTV connection and one for the TV = the Direct TV controller will control the TV channels but the TCL controller is needed for volume, Picture quality is great - as ROKU is part of the TV you can use it for all the APS - Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: $79.99 ACTIVATION IS A SCAM!!!
customer_reviews.text: For starters, this is a nice little TV. It's nothing special, but it has nice features and a nice photo quality, and good volume! HOWEVER, if you try to activate your TV and it says it failed and to call a phone number, DONT call it. It's a scam to try and get you to pay for your activation of your tv for anywhere from $79.99 to $229.99!! DO NOT PAY. Go to the Roku website, set up your account, and just hit "link a device". YOUR ACITIVATION OF YOUR TV IS FREE.
customer_reviews.author: philly

customer_reviews.title: Great TV Clear pic and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Just wrote a bad 1 star review because I thought that there was not a power cord. Well my husband put it on the wall and forgot to tell me that the cord came plugged in to the back of the tv and taped down (so I could not see it). I have powered it on, connected to wifi and it works great! Clear pic and great light weight tv. Perfect for my office. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle D.

customer_reviews.title: Great bedroom tv
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift and it’s being used in a bedroom. The overall quality for a tv around $150 is excellent. The picture and build quality seemed great for the price point. One of the nicest features was the integration with Roku which gave the ability to only have a power cable as the only cord needed to use the tv while having WiFi and full access to cable tv via the apps.
customer_reviews.author: Michael I

customer_reviews.title: TCL ROKU 32 INCH TV GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tv so easy to set up !My old 19 inch LCD tv in my kitchen died so I ordered this and received within a day.We have this tv in a 65 inch model in our mancave so I was very familiar with it only difference is the 65 inch has dolby atmos sound a little bit better picture on it it is a 6 series this is a 3 series other than that the features on the tv are great it connected quickly to my wifi and love the built in roku for streaming.Fabulous tv for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Kornblut

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about this but...
customer_reviews.text: The price, the weight, the smart TV parts.... all fantastic, BUT here's the deal breaker for me and why I am returning it. I need a TV to go to the last source input when it powers up, not a home screen where I have to make a selection of which input source I want. The inability of this simple behavior that most TVs have means that I cannot use just one remote (my fireTV stick remote) :( Reluctantly, I am returning this otherwise fine TV. I am hoping that future software upgrades will include this feature.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime K.

customer_reviews.title: Worst TV I've owned
customer_reviews.text: just got the TV last night and it's already a headache. I got this tv for my kids room and Sry it up last night. Everything went smoothly and the kids were really happy. Fast forward to today. The buttons on the remote are not receptive, it keeps dropping the internet and saying poor speed despite me testing and showing high speed and every other device in my house working perfectly. I hate it already. Pretty sure I'm sending it back
customer_reviews.author: Chantel Ross

customer_reviews.title: Features for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great TV to have in a small room, like a dorm or a bedroom. I bought this for my dorm in college and i am very happy with it, the picture quality is great, the remote is so easy to use. I primarily watch netflix, hulu, and disney plus, and the remote has buttons for all three, so you can go straight to the app. The volume is great too, I didn't expect for a TV so small and cheap to have such an amazing sound quality. Overall I am very happy with this product and you will be too.
customer_reviews.author: Rishav Poudel

customer_reviews.title: Tuner Doesn't Detect Most Clear QAM Channels
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up on Prime Day to replace a working bedroom TV. After scanning, only 50 of the 130 channels we received on the old bedroom TV and our living room TV were detected. I rechecked the cable line and reinstalled the old TV, no issue. We live in a rural area that broadcasts cable TV using clear QAM, so all the old and new TVs we've installed in the home are plug, scan, and watch. On the upside, we're down to one remote and it functions well as a Roku controller. Unfortunately, it functions poorly as a TV remote.
customer_reviews.author: NomNom

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: I just plugged it in and it worked. My grandson play games on it for hours. He loves it which makes me very happy. Because I have two grandsons I have two computers side by side and I have noticed that the graphics on this one not as vivid. So I bought a graphics card with an HDMI port. If you don't buy a graphics card you have to buy an HDMI adapter period. For the money I think it's a good buy. I hope it lasts a couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzy'sMom

customer_reviews.title: Great TV!
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome for the price! You can’t beat getting a smart tv for a little over a hundred bucks. The set up with the stand was quick and easy. Getting the TV set up with all of the streaming services and setting up the stand took under 10 minutes. Everything is pretty straightforward. You could do the whole set up without even glancing at the instructions. The sound quality isn’t perfect but I wouldn’t expect it to be with how cheap this tv is. The picture quality is awesome. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Martin

customer_reviews.title: Crappy Sound
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. A good tv for the bedroom but if you want decent sound, you need to buy external speakers. I tried connecting existing speakers but it does not accept them. I have to buy a Roku sound bar. I tried using the app to connect to my usb speaks via WiFi but Roku’s app stinks! It often times out and takes a full 30 seconds to restart every 10 minutes or so. So... in other words, the tv is ok for bedroom or kitschy use.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Solis

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for you buck!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought a TCL for our business in 2015. When we closed the business in 2017 it became our primary TV. With 5 people in our household, someone is always watching it. It's been so reliable. It has all the apps we use, Netflix, Hulu and even YouTube. I love that I can cast from my phone to it. We have been so impressed, we bought 3 for the kids for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly B.

customer_reviews.title: Great smart TV
customer_reviews.text: A great TV overall I thought it was going to be too small but it's actually a perfect size. It works best with a internet connection instead of a hotspot which I've been using but the videos kept buffering because the hotspot isn't a strong connection but the tv still works with the hotspot if you can't afford internet provider at the moment. It tells the time which is Kool there's no camera on it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great TV but still missing some channels
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great TV for the price! Love that you can use the Roku app as a work-around to use Bluetooth headphones (although it only works for TV and not attached consoles). I took one star off for the fact that Roku still hasn’t reached an agreement with HBO Max after months, very frustrating not to have that channel. Hoping the Peacock deal goes through at least.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I didnt care for the remote control
customer_reviews.text: with no numbers on the remote you have to go through every channel . you also cant manage your channels so if you dont want a certain channel you cant delete. (with cable or air tv) I like the tv. I only gave it 4 stars due to the remote and cant delete air or cable channels you dont watch. If you can I wish someone would tell me. I read the direction? and watched Youtube?
customer_reviews.author: dmh128

customer_reviews.title: Received product damaged. Don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I do NOT recommend this tv at all. I bought this as a graduation gift for my daughter. I was very disappointed and upset because the tv’s screen was damaged. It’s also upsetting because it will be a big inconvenience and challenge to return so I am now stuck with a tv I cannot use. Highly disappointed. My daughter is even more upset considering it was gift and and the sacrifice that came along with getting it. I sent this picture to a repair shop and they told me that this tv is not even worth fixing due to cost. I’m extremely upset because they sold me a defective tv that I am now stuck with, can’t return, nor repair.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: Good price, but screen has slight burn-in
customer_reviews.text: Convenient Roku ready TV and easy to use with a Roku controller. Good picture quality except the screen has a slight burn-in or memory shadow.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Estes

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price point
customer_reviews.text: This is a five star tv when taking into consideration the price. At the price point you get a nice smart tv. I purchased two to use as computer monitors for the kids online schooling so they weren’t stuck looking at a small chrome book. They work fantastic for that. One of the two came shattered and as ALWAYS amazon customer service was super easy to make the return and replacement
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Really good picture. Preloaded apps very helpful. Took only a few minutes to set up. Downloaded Xfinity app to go with Prime, Hulu and Netflix. Bought 2, mounted one outside on deck and the other in basement gym. The WI-FI reception on each is very good. Don't know how it will hold up outside but I built a surround for it and added a waterproof cover. So far so good. Update - 3/18/20- TV survived a New England winter outdoors and is working great.
customer_reviews.author: conmac96

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My other smart TV has a lag time to connect with the internet which is very annoying. This TV connects immediately. It has "feet" which are quite far apart and makes the TV too wide for my shelf but it is deep enough that it can just sit on the shelf on it's own. It's sturdy and doesn't appear it would ever tumble off the shelf except maybe in the case of an earthquake. I'm very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn M. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Seriously worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this television! The perfect size for my room and it has so many more functions than I thought. I was playing Spotify on my phone and it then prompted me to play it on the tv and I am amazed! The sound quality is great and it’s truly just a great tv for the price! The only negative, sometimes the sound goes out or gets scratchy and I need to unplug it and plug it back in for it to work again. That is the only bad thing I could see!
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn the functions
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this TV for my 84 year old father in law for his birthday. to say he is tech challenged would be an understatement, however he figured most of it out within a week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great TV !
customer_reviews.text: I purchased TCL 32S325 32 Inch 720p Roku Smart LED TV (2019) on Amazon Prime Day. It was delivered in 2 days. It is replacing a 19" flat screen in my guest room. This tv was so easy to set up! It takes a little time because it has to scan for channels but I am so happy I purchased it. My guests will love it. Very user friendly setup. Love having one remote for the antenna tv and Roku. No switching the live tv app is right on the same screen as the Roku apps.
customer_reviews.author: Pat F.

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: This TV literally would not turn on, just a flashing screen. Customer service lady was really nice, which was cool because I was on the phone with her for 40 minutes just to have her tell me to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: hillary roman

customer_reviews.title: Minor defects after a while
customer_reviews.text: After using for a while I gradually noticed a streak of discoloring appearing occasionally in one of the corners. Sometimes it reaches to about the middle of the screen, other times it is gone. Didn't use for a month and had a headache for a week after trying to get everything updated because the sound quit working for a while. Problem did fix itself after a few days, though. Overall good tv, though. Had mine for about 6 months now.
customer_reviews.author: Hiruno Takahashi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent TV considering the price
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a larger one (40") for my bedroom and this was the right size for my other bedroom. Very easy to setup, picture is fine for 720p, sound is good.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelG

customer_reviews.title: Good outweighs the bad
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems to work as advertised except the ability to screen share with apple products. That was a disappointment. Ended up hooking appletv to it. Also, the remote often won’t make connection to control tv. You pretty much have to be straight on front of the tv and nearly level with it.... pain, but what do you expect from a $127 tv.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, but older phones may not have all options.
customer_reviews.text: My room mate has the 2 year old model, that she has been well pleased with, so I ordered one. I was worried that setting it up would be a hassle for an old dinosaur like me, but it was quick and easy. My 2 year old phone isnt compatible with some of the advance options, so I will need to get a more current phone, but the TV is great. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with setup
customer_reviews.text: While setting up the system I had a problem with the activation. Set would not take the code provided. After calling the support number provided I was informed that there is a registration fee of $65 for 5 years or $99 for life for activation. I had previously purchased another set and both sets were turned off until I pay their fee. I will never purchase another Roku tv especially with a note on the set saying NO ACTIVATION FEE IS REQUIRED.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I like this TV, the low price and ability to hook up an external USB drive to it is what sold me on it, as I transfer a lot of movies this way and its nice to just be able to bring them up without another device. The only complaint I have is that it seems to lose network connectivity often. I can re-establish the link very easily, but its annoying to need to do this consistently. Besides that, buy this TV.
customer_reviews.author: Kane Winters

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great tv for the price. Got this so my son would stay off of family room tv with his Xbox. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: TV great, but did not arrive packaged correctly
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this TV. This is exactly what I needed to make my truck feel a little more like home when I'm out on the road. I give the TV itself 5 stars. I have deducted 1 star because it was supposed to be shipped in an Amazon box so it was not identifiable but it was not. I was able to tell there was a TV on the porch from the road and the area I live in is high traffic at the moment because of a subdivision being built. You will be VERY pleased with the TV!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: I month in and I Love this TV!
customer_reviews.text: I am a die hard Amazon fan, but my fire TV wasn't working with Spectrum. Roku is Spectrum compatible, got this TV and LOVE it. Not only for the compatibility but for the clarity and I dig the remote functions. I recommend this but it's only been about a month that I've had it so take that into account.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Sayers

customer_reviews.title: If you want smart TV don't buy!!
customer_reviews.text: The picture and sound quality on this tv was nice. But if you want a smart TV so not buy it. Wireless had to be reset every few days and then you had to factory reset the tv to get it to work again. Was a nightmare so returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Wonderguy1979

customer_reviews.title: Great picture
customer_reviews.text: This TV has a great picture and was easy to set up. The remote was a little off-putting with no numbers to go directly to a channel, but it will scroll very fast if you hold the button down. I also had a problem when I thought it was losing channels, but it was actually putting the most used channels at the top of the list. There were little hearts on these that I never noticed. The favorites show first, then the rest of your available channels. This is for antenna reception which is all I have. We liked it so well that my sister-in-law ordered one the next size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great ROKU WiFi reception.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about the ability of these ROKU enabled Smart TVs to receive the WiFi signal from my NETGEAR Nighthawk AC router downstairs in our 2 story home. No problem! Both TVs scanned and found the signals on the first pass and have provided strong, solid programming. Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: Works great and you can turn your phone into a remote
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves this TV. It is great and picks up Disney+, Amazon Prime Video, Netflix, and Hulu perfectly. It has buttons on the bottom of the remote with 4 different services on it so it is easy for kids to use. My kid is 4 and she can work her remote. Also, you can get a Roku app on your phone and use your phone as a remote. Overall I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha G.

customer_reviews.title: Great price and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Way better than I thought it would be and the set up was so easy!! Pleasantly surprised with the adaptation to a bunny ears old fashion antenna type.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never heard of TCL... Now I recommend them.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 32" model for my mother as a replacement television. Her previous model was a much older 32" LCD and I couldn't believe how light and compact the TCL was. I set installed it on the the wall and set it up. The configuration was extremely simple not just for me but also for my 75 year old mom. I liked this so much I ended up buying a 50" inch for me on black Friday. Before this I had never heard of TCL. Now I recommend them to everyone as a great budget television without sacrificing much despite the low cost.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Meneses

customer_reviews.title: Great smart TV
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my Roku TV. It has a great picture and is easy to use. The remote is kinda small, but we're getting used to it. I highly recommend this TV. I bought one for our living room and after using it for a few weeks decided to purchase another one for our bedroom. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: CounselorLaura

customer_reviews.title: Super happy with my TV
customer_reviews.text: Great TV. The sound from the tv is of pretty good quality. The remote is ok. You do have to aim it right at the TV but you can easily upgrade to a better Roku remote or use the app on your phone to get around that. It's a 720 so the picture can only be so great. Super happy with my TV. Thanks TCL.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Have to reconnect to internet too often
customer_reviews.text: We own another smart TV and this is the only one that forces me to reconnect to the internet about half the time. The other TV is samsung brand and we've never had this problem. It's not a huge deal, just annoying. Other than that, the TV has been just fine for a bedroom TV.
customer_reviews.author: jordan

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit.  Impressed so far.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, nice picture quality. What impressed me the most is that usually smaller tv's are very limited in how much volume they have. This one is capable of very loud volumes comparable to other 32" sets I've had. No issues getting the apps downloaded or using them. Impressed.
customer_reviews.author: crimedog

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: It's CHEAPLY made. Easily broken. Screen quit working after one week and the TCL company refuses to do anything about it. Edit : I came here to add something. Today the tv I replaced this broken crap with ( a USED Visio) fell off the wall , flipped, and slammed into my wall so hard that it broke a hole in my wall and it still works. It still works !!! I still can't believe this TCL tv broke from a little foam nerf bullet.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie jarvis

product_meta.title: TCL 32S325 32 Inch 720p Roku Smart LED TV (2019)
product_meta.description: Size:32 Inch| Style:TV onlyA full high definition display paired with an advanced refresh rate, and dual-band Wifi allows you to capture every moment. With a sleek, modern design it looks great whether it is off or on. No more flipping through inputs or wading through complicated menus. Like apps on a smartphone, all your favorites are at your fingertips from the instant you turn it on. Choose from thousands of streaming channels that feature over 500,000 movie and TV episodes plus live sports, news, music, kids and family, food, science and tech, fitness, foreign language, and so much more.
feature_bullets: Dimensions (W x H x D): TV without stand: 28.8 x 17.1 x 3.1 Inches, TV with stand: 28.8 x 19 x 6.8 Inches
Smart functionality delivers all your favorite content with over 500,000 movies and TV episodes, accessible through the simple and intuitive Roku TV
720p HD resolution for a crisp picture. Stand Separation Distance - 21.3 inch
Compatible with Alexa and Google Assistant
Direct lit LED produces great picture quality. USB File Format Compatibility Video MKV (H.264), MP4, MOV (H.264), TS (H.264) Music AAC, MP3, WMA, WAV (PCM), AIFF, FLAC, AC3 Photo JPG, PNG, GIF
Inputs: 3 HDMI 2.0 with HDCP 2.2 (one with HDMI ARC), 1 USB (media player), RF, Composite, Headphone Jack, Optical Audio Out

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars22,644 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
